name: Version
description: Thiswill be for v4, as opposed to v6, a 4 bit field= 0100

name: DS
description: Differentiated Services: Used for QoS: DiffServ–DS field or the older IntServ–ToSor Type of Service

name: Time-to-Live
description: Layer 3 hop count. When it becomes zero the routerwill discard the packet

name: Protocol
description: I.D.s next level protocol: ICMP, TCP, UDP, etc.

name: Header Checksum
description: Detect corruption in the IPv4 header

name: Source IP Address
description: 32 bit source address

name: Destination IP Address
description: 32 bit destination address

name: Source Port (16)
description: A 16-bit field used to identify the source application by port number.

name: Destination Port (16)
description: A 16-bit field used to identify the destination application by port number.

name: Length (16)
description: A 16-bit field that indicates the length of the UDP datagram header.

name: Checksum (16)
description: A 16-bit field used for error checking of the datagram header and data.

name: Source Port (16)
description: A 16-bit field used to identify the source application by port number.

name: Destination Port (16)
description: A 16-bit field used to identify the destination application by port number.

name: Sequence Number (32)
description: A 32-bit field used for data reassembly purposes.

name: Acknowledgment Number (32)
description: A 32-bit field used to indicate that data has been received and the next byte expected from the source.

name: Header Length (4)
description: A 4-bit field known as ʺdata offsetʺ that indicates the length of the TCP segment header.

name: Reserved (6)
description: A 6-bit field that is reserved for future use.

name: Control bits (6)
description: A 6-bit field used that includes bit codes, or flags, which indicate the purpose and function of the TCP segment.

name: Window (16)
description: A 16-bit field used to indicate the number of bytes that can be accepted at one time

name: Checksum (16)
description: A 16-bit field used for error checking of the segment header and data.

name: Urgent (16)
description: A 16-bit field used to indicate if the contained data is urgent.

name: Version
description: This will be for v6, as opposed to v4, a 4 bit field= 0110

name: Traffic Class
description: Used for QoS: Equivalent to DiffServ–DS field

name: Flow Label
description: Informs device to handle identical flow labels the same way, 20 bit field

name: Payload Length
description: This 16-bit field indicates the length of the data portion or payload of the IPv6 packet

name: Next Header
description: I.D.s next level protocol: ICMP, TCP, UDP, etc.

name: Hop Limit
description: Replaces TTL field Layer 3 hop count

name: Source IP Address
description: 128 bit source address

name: Destination IP Address
description: 128 bit destination address
